intro: Homalanthus longistylus, commonly known as the long-styled pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
